definition: to pacify the country
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping
day/sky/heaven
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: This practice has nothing to do with the nation or society you live in.
sentences.chinese: 修行者也完全沒有要治國，甚至平天下的宏願。

sentences.english: The administration and pacification of the states and world is the chief subject of the traditional chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: “治國平天下”，是中國傳統文化的第一主題。

definition: to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
to rule a country
to bring peace and stability to the country
to govern one's family/to manage one's household
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
love to all creatures (idiom, from Mencius); universal benevolence
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
not corrupted by wealth and honors
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to make the world a better place
filial piety and fraternal duty
Confucius and Mencius
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
Confucian

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
